statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Chauncey Billups scored 27 points,
including 20 in the first quarter, as the Detroit Pistons built an
early lead and maintained it without their best player in a 106-84
win over the undermanned New Jersey Nets on Saturday night.
article.headline: Billups scores 27 for Pistons
article.linkText: Undermanned Nets find Pistons too tough
article.story:
AUBURN HILLS, Mich. (AP) -- Chauncey Billups scored 27 points, including 20 in the first quarter, as the Detroit Pistons built an early lead and maintained it without their best player in a 106-84 win over the undermanned New Jersey Nets on Saturday night. Kenyon Martin tied his season-high with 29 points for the Nets, who had won four straight. New Jersey was without its two leading scorers -- Jason Kidd (strained groin) and Richard Jefferson (stomach virus) -- for a second straight game. The Nets hope both will play Monday at home against Seattle. Pistons center Ben Wallace left the game at halftime after learning that his mother had been taken to an Alabama hospital, where she later died. Wallace, who will start for the East in the All-Star Game next week, tied a team record with seven blocks in the first half against the Nets. He also grabbed seven rebounds and scored two points. Richard Hamilton scored 24 for the Pistons, who won their third straight. Reserve Corliss Williamson scored 17 and Cliff Robinson added 12. New Jersey has lost five of seven games on the road. Brian Scalabrine scored 16 and Kerry Kittles added 15 for the Nets. Detroit, which won Friday at Boston by 52 points for its most lopsided win ever, got off to a strong start thanks to Billups. Billups had 10 points as Detroit jumped out to a 14-2, and his 20th point -- on a spectacular reverse layup -- gave the Pistons a 32-15 lead with 1:55 in the first quarter. New Jersey then closed the first quarter with a 10-2 run to make it 34-25. Detroit led by 18 at halftime and didn't let the Nets cut the cushion to single digits until they made a final push to make it 87-78 with 6:02 left. The Pistons ended New Jersey's comeback hopes with a 10-2 run. Game notes
Detroit won the season series against New Jersey 2-1. ... Kidd and Jefferson average a combined 35.4 points, 12.3 rebounds and 10.6 assists. ... Detroit is 25-3 against New Jersey at The Palace, its best record against any team. ... Wallace tied the blocks record set by Edgar Jones in 1981, and matched by Terry Tyler in 1982. ... Detroit is 11-6 against winning teams in the Eastern Conference. ... Billups has scored 67 points in his past three games. ... Martin fell two points short of his career-high.
